description: TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION TO APPOINT A COMMITTEE TO REPORT THE NAVAL FORCE NECESSARY TO CARRY OUT A TREATY WITH MOROCCO, TO RANSOM PRISONERS, AND TO ESTABLISH PEACE WITH ALGERINES, TOGETHER WITH AN ESTIMATE OF THE EXPENSE; SAID AMENDMENT TO ADD, "AND THE WYS FOR DEFRAYING THE SAME."  (P
TO PASS S. 1, (APP. 1/13/1794), AN ACT MAKING AN ALTERATION IN THE FLAG OF THE UNITED STATES.  (P. 166)
TO AMEND H.R. 1, A BILL TO COMPLETE AND SUPPORT THE MILITARY ESTABLISHMENT, BY ELIMINATING THE PROVISION TO ALLOW EXTRA COMPENSATION TO COMMISSIONED OFFICERS WHO MEET CERTAIN REQUIREMENTS.
TO AMEND H.R. 1, A BILL TO COMPLETE AND SUPPORT THE MILITARY ESTABLISHMENT, BY PROVIDING A PENSION FOR THE WIDOWS AND ORPHANS OF OFFICERS KILLED FROM WOUNDS RECEIVED IN SERVICE. (P. 255)
TO POSTPONE THE RESOLUTION CONCERNING PRIVILEGES AND RESTRICTIONS ON THE COMMERCE OF THE UNITED STATES IN FOREIGN COUNTRIES, UNTIL MARCH.
TO PASS THE RESOLUTION THAT HENRY LATIMER IS ENTITLED TO A SEAT IN THIS HOUSE, AS REPRESENTATIVE OF THE STATE OF DELAWARE.

TO PASS THE RESOLUTION THAT A NAVAL FORCE OF FOUR SHIPS AND TWO SHIPS OF FORTY-FOUR AND TWENTY GUNS RESPECTIVELY, BE PROVIDED FOR THE PROTECTION OF UNITED STATES COMMERCE AGAINST ALGERINE CRUISERS.  (P. 459)

TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION AMENDING THE CONSTITUTION BY PROVIDING THAT THE JUDICIAL POWER SHALL NOT BE CONSTRUED TO EXTEND TO ANY SUIT IN LAW OR EQUITY COMMENCED OR PROSECUTED AGAINST ONE OF THE STATES BY CITIZENS OF ANOTHER STATE, OR A FOREIGN POWER; WHICHAMENDMENT ADDS, "WHEN A STATE SHALL HAVE PREVIOUSLY MADE PROVISION IN THEIR OWN COURTS, SUCH SUIT MAY BE PROSECUTED TO EFFECT."

TO CONCUR IN THE RESOLUTION AMENDING THE CONSTITUTION BY PROVIDING THAT THE JUDICIAL POWER SHALL NOT BE CONSTRUED TO EXTEND TO ANY SUIT IN LAW OR EQUITY COMMENCED OR PROSECUTED AGAINST ONE OF THE STATES BY CITIZENS OF ANY OTHER STATE, OR OF A FOREIGN STAE
TO PASS H.R. 14, (APP. 3/26/1794), A BILL FOR THE PROTECTION OF AMERICAN COMMERCE AGAINST ALGERINE CRUISERS  (P. 497)
TO PASS THE RESOLUTION TO APPOINT A COMMITTEE TO REPORT ON THE PRACTICABILITY OF OBTAINING A STATEMENT OF THE SETTLEMENTS OF ACCOUNTS OF THE INDIVIDUAL STATES WITH THE GENERAL GOVERNMENT.  (P. 563)

TO PUT THE MAIN QUESTION ON PASSAGE OF THE RESOLUTION TO PROHIBIT ALL COMMERCIAL INTERCOURSE BETWEEN THE CITIZENS OF THE UNITED STATES AND SUBJECTS OF GREAT BRITAIN, SO FAR AS THE SAME RESPECTS ARTICLES OF GROWTH OR MANUFACTURE OF GREAT BRITIAN OR IRELAN.
TO CONSIDER THE REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE CONSIDERING THE GREAT BRITAIN RESOLUTION.
TO PASS THE GREAT BRITAIN RESOLUTION.  (P. 602)
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF H.R. 40, A BILL TO SUSPEND THE IMPORTATION OF CERTAIN GOODS, WARES AND MERCHANDISE.
TO PASS H.R. 40, A BILL TO SUSPEND THE IMPORTATION OF CERTAIN GOODS, WARES AND MERCHANDISE.  (P. 606)

TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION CONCERNING THE REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE APPOINTED TO INQUIRE WHETHER ANY FURTHER REVENUES ARE NECESSARY FOR THE SUPPORT OF THE PUBLIC CREDIT, AND, IF SO, TO REPORT THE WAYS AND MEANS, BY STRIKING OUT THE RESOLUTION FOR A SPECIFIED ARRIAGE TAX
TO AMEND THE PUBLIC CREDIT RESOLUTION, BY STRIKING OUT THE RESOLUTION TO IMPOSE STAMP DUTIES.
TO AMEND THE PUBLIC CREDIT RESOLUTION BY ADDING THE WORDS: "IN THE COURTS OF THE UNITED STATES" TO THE SECTION PLACING A $5 TAX ON LICENSES OF CERTAIN LAW PERSONEL.  (P. 666)
TO AMEND THE PUBLIC CREDIT RESOLUTION, BY ELIMINATING THE DUTY ON TOBACCO MANUFACTURED IN THE UNITED STATES.  (P. 667)
TO AMEND THE PUBLIC CREDIT RESOLUTION, BY STRIKING OUT THE PROVISION FOR A TAX OF 6 CENTS PER TON ON ALL UNITED STATES VESSELS EMPLOYED IN FOREIGN TRADE.  (P. 670)
TO AMEND THE PUBLIC CREDIT RESOLUTION, BY INCREASING THE DUTY ON FOREIGN TONNAGE FROM 25 CENTS, TO 50 CENTS.  (P. 670
TO AMEND THE PUBLIC CREDIT RESOLUTION, BY MAKING THE DUTY ON TONNAGE OF BRITISH VESSELS, TWICE THE DUTY ON ALL OTHERS.
TO AMEND THE PUBLIC CREDIT RESOLUTION, BY STRIKING OUT THE 25 CENT TAX ON DEEDS.  (P. 672)

TO AMEND THE HOUSE JOINT RESOLUTION THAT THE PRESENT EMBARGO BE CONTINUED, AND EVERY REGULATION THEREON SHALL BE IN FORCE UNTIL JUNE 20; BY INSERTING AFTER THE WORD "CONTINUED", THE WORDS: "UPON ALL VESSELS BOUND TO THE WEST INDIES, BERMUDA, OR NOVA SCOTA".
TO PASS THE HOUSE JOINT RESOLUTION THAT THE PRESENT EMBARGO BE CONTINUED AND EVERY REGULATION THEREON SHALL BE IN FULL FORCE UNTIL JUNE 20TH NEXT.

TO AMEND H.R. 39, A BILL TO MAKE PROVISION FOR THE PAYMENT OF THE INTEREST ON THE BALANCES DUE TO CERTAIN STATES; BY PROVIDING THAT THE BALANCES REPORTED, AND CARRIED TO THE DEBIT OF CERTAIN STATES, BE RELINQUISHED.
TO AMEND H.R. 39, BY PROVIDING "THAT PAYMENT OF INTEREST SHALL CEASE AFTER 1798, WHEN THE BALANCE DUE WILL BE APPROPRIATED FOR PAYMENT OF INTEREST AND PRINCIPAL DUE SAID STATES."  (P. 685)
TO PUT THE MAIN QUESTION ON ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF H.R. 39.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT OF H.R. 39.
TO POSTPONE THIRD READING OF H.R. 39 TO NEXT OCTOBER. (P. 687)

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO THE RESOLUTION "THAT THE UNITED STATES WILL GUARANTEE INDEMNIFICATION OF ALL CITIZENS WHOSE PROPERTY MAY HAVE BEEN CONFISCATED UNDER AUTHORITY OF GREAT BRITAIN; BY ADDING TO THE AMENDMENT TO REFER THE RESOLUTION TO THE COMMITTEE F THE WHOLE HOUSE, THE WORDS: "TO WHOM WAS REFERRED THE RESOLUTION FOR THE SEQUESTRATION OF BRITISH DEBTS."
TO PASS H.R. 39.

TO AMEND H.R. 46, A BILL TO LAY ADDITIONAL DUTY ON GOODS, WARES AND MERCHANDISE IMPORTED INTO THE UNITED STATES, AND ON THE TONNAGE OF SHIPS OR VESSELS; BY PROVIDING FOR AN ADDITIONAL DUTY OF SIX CENTS PER TON ON ALL SHIPS OR VESSELS.
TO PASS H.R. 50, A BILL TO LAY A DUTY ON MANUFACTURED TABACCO AND REFINED SUGAR.
TO AMEND H.R. 32, A BILL TO AUGMENT THE MILITARY FORCE OF THE UNITED STATES; BY PROVIDING FOR AN ADDITIONAL PROVISIONAL MILITARY FORCE, SPECIFICS OF WHICH ARE ENUMERATED IN THE AMENDMENT.  (P. 709)
TO AMEND H.R. 47, A BILL TO COMPENSATE ARTHUR ST. CLAIR, BY PROVIDING FURTHER COMPENSATION FOR THE TIME HE WAS EMPLOYED IN THE BUSINESS OF INDIAN TREATIES.  (P. 711)
TO PASS H.R. 47, A BILL TO COMPENSATE ARTHUR ST.CLAIR. (P. 711)
TO ORDER THIRD READING OF S. 8, A BILL FOR THE CLAIM OF THE WIDOW AND CHILDREN OF ROBERT FORSYTH.  (P. 712)

TO PASS THE RESOLUTION TO SUSPEND ALL COMMERCIAL INTERCOURSE WITH BRITISH WEST INDIES, UNTIL GREAT BRITAIN ASSURES THE UNITED STATES OF HER INTENTION TO COMPENSATE UNITED STATES CITIZENS FOR INJURIES DONE THEM BY WAR SHIPS AND PRIVATEERS.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF H.R. 53, A BILL TO LAY DUTIES ON STAMPED VELLUM, PARCHMENT AND PAPER.
TO PASS H.R. 53, A BILL TO LAY DUTIES ON STAMPED VELLUM, PARCHMENT AND PAPER.  (P. 726)
TO PASS H.R. 55, A BILL TO LAY DUTIES UPON CARRIAGES FOR THE CONVEYANCE OF PERSONS.  (P. 730)
TO PASS S. 18, AN ACT TO INCREASE THE MILITARY FORCE OF THE UNITED STATES, AND TO ENCOURAGE RECRUITING.  (P. 738)
TO PASS H.R. 56, A BILL TO LAY DUTIES ON LICENSES FOR SELLING WINES AND DISTILLED SPIRITS, BY RETAIL.
TO PASS H.R. 57, AN ACT PROVIDING FOR THE PAYMENT OF A CERTAIN SUM OF MONEY DUE TO THE FRENCH REPUBLIC.
TO PASS S. 58, AN ACT LAYING DUTIES ON PROPERTY SOLD AT AUCTIONS.  (P. 741)
TO RESOLVE INTO COMMITTEE IN ORDER TO CONSIDER S. 4, AN ACT IN ADDITION TO AN ACT FOR THE PUNISHMENT OF CERTAIN CRIMES IN THE UNITED STATES.

TO AGREE WITH THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE TO AN AMENDMENT TO S. 4, AN ACT IN ADDITION TO AN ACT FOR THE PUNISHMENT OF CERTAIN CRIMES AGAINST THE UNITED STATES, AMENDMENT TO PROHIBIT THE SALE OF GOODS CAPTURED FROM A STATE OR ITS SUBJECTS, AT PEACE WITH TH UNITED STATES
TO PASS H.R. 54, A BILL TO MAKE FURTHER COMPENSATION FOR THE SERVICES OF ROBERT FORSYTH, WHO WAS KILLED IN THE SERVICE OF THE UNITED STATES.
TO PASS S. 15, AN ACT TO AUTHORIZE THE PRESIDENT, DURING RECESS OF THE CONGRESS, TO CAUSE TO BE PURCHASED OR BUILT, A NUMBER OF VESSELS TO BE EQUIPPED AS GALLEYS.
TO ORDER THIRD READING OF S. 17, AN ACT ALLOWING AN ADDITIONAL COMPENSATION TO THE PRINCIPLE CLERKS IN THE DEPARTMENTS OF STATE, TREASURY AND WAR, FOR THE YEAR 1794.

TO CONCUR IN THE SENATE AMENDMENT TO THE HOUSE CONCURRENT RESOLUTION FOR THE MORE EFFECTUAL PROTECTION OF THE SOUTHWESTERN FRONTIER SETTLERS; AMENDMENT TO STRIKE OUT THE PROVISION FOR THE PRESIDENT TO CALL OUT STATE MILITA AGAINST THE INDIANS, AND TO SUBTITUTE A PROVISION TO AUTHORIZE AN ADDITIONAL REGIMENT OF INFANTRY.

TO ADHERE TO THE DISAGREEMENT TO THE SENATE AMENDMENT TO THE HOUSE CONCURRENT RESOLUTION FOR MORE EFFECTUAL PROTECTION OF THE SOUTHWESTERN FRONTIER SETTLERS; SAID AMENDMENT PROVIDES A BONUS OF $20 FOR ANY PERSON ENLISTING INTO SERVICE.
TO AMEND THE HOUSE ANSWER TO THE PRESIDENT'S MESSAGE, BY ELIMINATING THE PHRASE "SELF CREATED SOCIETIES" FROM THE RESOLUTION.
TO AMEND THE PRESIDENT'S MESSAGE RESOLUTION, TO STATE THAT SAID INSURRECTION HAD ITS ORIGIN IN THE FOUR WESTERN COUNTRIES OF PENNSYLVANIA. (SPEAKER VOTING IN THE AFFIRMATIVE).
TO AMEND THE PRESIDENT'S MESSAGE RESOLUTION, TO STATE THAT THE INSURRECTION WAS COUNTENANCED BY SELF CREATED SOCIETIES ELSEWHERE.  (P. 944)
TO PASS THE RESOLUTION TO THANK MAJOR GENERAL WAYNE AND OTHERS FOR GOOD CONDUCT AND BRAVERY IN ACTION, AUGUST 20, AGAINST THE INDIANS.

TO AGREE WITH THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE IN THEIR DISAGREEMENT TO THE RESOLUTION TO APPOINT A COMMITTEE TO BRING IN A BILL TO REGULATE THE PAY AND ALLOWANCES TO THE COMMISSIONED OFFICERS, MUSICIANS, AND PRIVATES OF THE MILITIA OF THE UNITED STATES.

TO PASS THE RESOLUTION TO REQUEST THE PRESIDENT TO CAUSE AN INVESTIGATION TO BE MADE OF PROPERTY LOSSES SUSTAINED BY OFFICERS OF THE GOVERNMENT AND OTHER CITIZENS, IN CONSE- QUENCE OF THEIR EXERTIONS ON SUPPORT OF THE LAWS, BEING VIOLATED BY THE INSURGENS IN THE WESTERN COUNTIES OF PENNSYLVANIA.

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 83, AN ACT TO AMEND AN ACT TO ESTABLISH A UNIFORM RULE OF NATURALIZATION; WHICH AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT ANY ALIEN HOLDING SLAVES SHALL RENOUNCE ALL CLAIM TO SUCH SLAVES WHEN HE APPLIES FOR CITIZENSHIP. (P. 1041)
TO AMEND H.R. 83, AN ACT TO ESTABLISH A UNIFORM SYSTEM OF NATURALIZATION, BY PROVIDING THAT ANY ALIEN MUST RENOUNCE ANY TITLE OR ORDER OF NOBILITY IN ORDER TO BECOME A CITIZEN.
TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION TO AUTHORIZE A TREATY TO BE HELD IN RELATION TO INDIAN TITLES OF LAND, BY PROVIDING FOR THE REIMBURSMENT OF MONEY AND RELINQUISHMENT OF LANDS BOUGHT IN INDIAN TERRITORY.

TO AMEND H.R. 106, A BILL FOR CONTINUING AND REGULATING THE MILITARY ESTABLISHMENT AND FOR REPEALING SUNDRY ACTS HERETOFORE PASSED ON THAT SUBJECT, BY PROVIDING FOR THE REDUCTION OF TROOPS WHEN EVER THERE SHALL BE PEACE WITH THE INDIAN TRIBES.

TO AMEND H.R. 106, A BILL TO CONTINUE AND REGULATE THE MILITARY ESTABLISHMENT AND TO REPEAL CERTAIN ACTS, BY ADDING THE WORDS "FOR THE PROTECTION AND SECURITY OF THE UNITED STATES AGAINST FOREIGN INVASIONS, AND AGAINST THE INDIAN TRIBES".

TO AMEND H.R. 110, A BILL TO MAKE FURTHER PROVISION FOR THE SUPPORT OF THE PUBLIC CREDIT, AND FOR THE REDEMPTION OF THE PUBLIC DEBT, BY STRIKING OUT THE PHRASE "AND SHALL BE VESTED IN THE COMMISSIONERS, AS PROPERTY IN TRUST TO BE APPLIED ACCORDING TO CERAIN PROVISIONS, TO THE REDEMPTION OF THE DEBT."  (P
TO REJECT S. 30, AN ACT TO PREVENT DEPREDATIONS ON THE INDIANS SOUTH OF THE OHIO RIVER.  (P. 1256)
TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION TO PREVENT DEPREDATIONS ON CERTAIN INDIANS; BY PROVIDING FOR THE PUNISHMENT OF UNAUTHORIZED ARMED PERSONS WITH HOSTILE INTENT FOUND ON LANDS SECURED TO THE INDIANS BY TREATY.
TO PASS H.R. 128, A BILL TO AUTHORIZE THE PRESIDENT TO OBTAIN THE CESSION OF CERTAIN TERRITORIES IN GEORGIA. (P. 1280)
TO POSTPONE CONSIDERATION OF THE TREATY OF PEACE AND FRIENDSHIP WITH THE WABASH AND ILLINOIS INDIANS, UNTIL THE NEXT SESSION OF CONGRESS.
TO AGREE TO THE RESOLUTION THAT THE SENATE DO CONSENT TO THE TREATY ENTERED INTO SEPTEMBER, 1792, WITH THE WABASH AND ILLINOIS INDIANS, AND THAT THEY DO ADVISE THE PRESIDENT TO RATIFY THE SAME.
TO POSTPONE CONSIDERATION OF THE NOMINATION OF JOHN JAY TO BE ENVOY EXTRAORDINARY OF THE UNITED STATES TO ENGLAND.
TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF JOHN JAY TO BE ENVOY EXTRAORDINARY TO GREAT BRITIAN.

TO PASS THE RESOLUTION THAT THE FOLLOWING ARTICLE BE PROPOSED TO LEGISLATURES OF STATES, AS AN AMENDMENT TO THE CONSTITUTION: THE JUDICIAL POWER OF THE UNITED STATES SHALL NOT BE CONSTRUED TO EXTEND TO ANY SUIT IN LAW OR EQUITY COMMENCED OR PROSECUTED AGINST ONE OF THE UNITED STATES BY CITIZENS OF ANOTHER STATE OR FOREIGN COUNTRY.

TO AMEND S.J.R.1, A RESOLUTION FOR AN AMENDMENT TO THE CONSTITUTION, ADDING TO THE 9TH SECTION OF THE FIRST ARTICLE A PROVISION FORBIDDING THE HOLDING OF A SEAT IN CONGRESS BY ANY OFFICER OR STOCKHOLDER IN ANY BANK IN THE UNITED STATES, WHICH AMENDMENT FRBIDS ANY PERSON HOLDING OFFICE IN THE BANK OF THE UNITED STATES TO BE A MEMBER OF CONGRESS, BUT NO POWER TO GRANT ANY CHARTER OF INCORPORATION OR ANY COMMERCIAL OR OTHER MONOPLY, SHALL BE HEREBY IMPLIED.

TO PASS THE AMENDED RESOLUTION, S.J.R.1, PROPOSING A CONSTITUTIONAL AMENDMENT TO PROVIDE THAT NO OFFICE HOLDER IN THE BANK OF THE UNITED STATES SHALL BE A MEMBER OF CONGRESS WHILE HE HOLDS SUCH OFFICE.
TO ORDER SECOND READING OF THE BILL TO AMEND THE ACT TO INCORPORATE THE SUBSCRIBERS TO THE BANK OF THE UNITED STATES.  (P. 33)

TO AGREE TO THE RESOLUTION TO REQUEST THE PRESIDENT TO LAY BEFORE THE SENATE, THE CORRESPONDENCES WHICH OCCURRED BE- TWEEN THE U.S. MINISTER TO FRANCE, AND SAID REPUBLIC AND BETWEEN SAID MINISTER AND THE SECRETARY OF STATE. (P. 38)

TO POSTPONE TO THE NEXT SESSION, THE RESOLUTION THAT IT BE A STANDING RULE TO HAVE THE DOORS OPEN WHILE THE SENATE SITS IN LEGISLATIVE AND JUDICIARY CAPACITY, EXCEPT ON OCCASIONS WHICH REQUIRE SECRECY.  (P. 46)
TO RECONSIDER THE SENATE CHAMBER RESOLUTION.
TO AMEND THE SENATE CHAMBERS RESOLUTION TO PROVIDE THAT THE GALLERIES BE OPENED EVERY MORNING EXCEPT UNDER CERTAIN CIRCUMSTANCES.
TO PASS THE SENATE CHAMBERS RESOLUTION.  (P. 47)
TO PASS THE RESOLUTION THAT ALBERT GALLATIN, RETURNED TO THIS HOUSE AS A MEMBER FROM PENNSYLVANIA, IS DULY QUALIFIED FOR AND ELECTED TO, A SEAT IN THE SENATE.  (P. 57A)
TO AGREE TO THE FIRST PART OF THE GALLATIN RESOLUTION, THAT THE ELECTION OF ALBERT GALLATIN WAS VOID.
TO PASS THE AMENDED GALLATIN RESOLUTION.

TO AMEND S. 4, (APP. 6/5/1794, 1 STAT 381), AN ACT IN ADDITION TO THE ACT FOR THE PUNISHMENT OF CERTAIN CRIMES AGAINST THE UNITED STATES; BY STRIKING THE PROVISION FORBIDDING THE SALE, WITHIN THE UNITED STATES, OF ANY VESSEL OR GOODS CAPTURED FOR A PEACEUL FOREIGN STATE
TO AMEND S. 4 TO FORBID THE SALE OF ANY VESSEL OR GOODS CAPTURED FROM A FOREIGN STATE. (VICE PRESIDENT VOTING IN THE AFFIRMATIVE).
TO AMEND S. 4 TO PROVIDE THAT THE BILL IS IN FORCE FOR SIX MONTHS.
TO AMEND S. 4 TO PROVIDE THAT THIS BILL SHALL BE IN FORCE TWO YEARS.  (P. 67A)
TO ORDER THIRD READING OF S. 4. (VICE PRESIDENT VOTING IN THE AFFIRMATIVE).
TO AMEND S. 4, BY STRIKING OUT THE SECTION CONCERNING DETAINMENT OF CERTAIN VESSELS BY THE PRESIDENT. (VICE PRESIDENT VOTING IN THE NEGATIVE).  (P. 68A)
TO PASS S. 4. (VICE PRESIDENT VOTING IN THE AFFIRMATIVE).
TO PASS THE RESOLUTION TO APPOINT A SELECT COMMITTEE TO REPORT ON SETTLEMENT OF THE ACCOUNTS OF THE INDIVIDUAL STATES.  (P. 73A)
TO REFER TO THE COMMITTEE OF ELECTIONS, THE APPOINTMENT OF KENSEY JOHNS, TO BE A UNITED STATES SENATOR, BY THE GOVERNOR OF DELAWARE.  (P. 73B)
TO PASS THE RESOLUTION THAT KENSEY JOHNS, APPOINTED BY THE GOVERNOR OF DELAWARE AS A SENATOR, IS NOT ENTITLED TO A SEAT IN THE SENATE, FOR CERTAIN THEREIN MENTIONED REASONS.
TO PASS S. 8, (APP. 6/7/1794, 1 STAT 392), A BILL TO MAKE PROVISIONS FOR THE WIDOW AND CHILDREN OF ROBERT FORSYTH, KILLED IN THE SERVICE OF THE UNITED STATES.  (P. 79)
TO CONCUR IN THE AMENDED HOUSE JOINT RESOLUTION TO CONTINUE THE PRESENT EMBARGO ON SHIPS OR VESSELS IN THE PORTS OF THE UNITED STATES, BOUND TO ANY FOREIGN PLACE OR PORT.
TO RECEDE FROM A SENATE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 13, (APP. 5/8/1794, 1 STAT 354), A BILL TO ESTABLISH THE POST OFFICE AND POST ROADS WITHIN THE UNITED STATES.

TO REFER THE RESOLUTION, THAT THE LETTER OF THE COMMITTEE OF PUBLIC SAFETY OF THE FRENCH REPUBLIC, BE TRANSMITTED TO THE PRESIDENT AND THAT HE BE REQUESTED TO CAUSE THE SAME TO BE ANSWERED, TO A COMMITTEE.
TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION TO SEND THE LETTER OF THE COMMITTEE OF FRENCH PUBLIC SAFETY TO THE PRESIDENT WITH A REQUEST TO ANSWER IT, "ON BEHALF OF THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES." (P. 88)
TO AGREE TO THE FIRST SECTION OF H.R. 40, A BILL REGARDING THE SUSPENSION OF IMPORTATION OF CERTAIN GOODS; SAID SECTION FORBIDS IMPORTATION OF ANY MERCHANDISE FROM GREAT BRITAIN AND IRELAND.
TO ORDER THIRD READING OF H.R. 40, A BILL REGARDING THE SUSPENSION OF IMPORTATION OF CERTAIN GOODS. (VICE PRESIDENT VOTING IN THE NEGATIVE).
TO PUT THE MAIN QUESTION ON INTRODUCING A BILL PROVIDING, UNDER CERTAIN LIMITATIONS, FOR THE SUSPENSION OF THE FOURTH ARTICLE OF THE TREATY OF PEACE WITH GREAT BRITIAN.
TO ALLOW INTRODUCTION OF A BILL PROVIDING UNDER CERTAIN LIMITATIONS, FOR THE SUSPENSION OF THE 4TH ARTICLE OF THE TREATY OF PEACE BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND GREAT BRITIAN.

TO AMEND S. 11, (APP. 6/7/1794, 1 STAT 390), A BILL TO MAKE FURTHER PROVISION FOR THE PROTECTION OF THE FRONTIERS OF THE UNITED STATES, BY PAYING TO EACH PRIVATE SOLDIER, THE ADDITIONAL PAY OF $1 PER MONTH.  (P. 96A)

TO AMEND S. 11, (APP. 6/7/1794, 1 STAT 390), A BILL TO MAKE FURTHER PROVISION FOR THE PROTECTION OF THE FRONTIERS; BY STRIKING FROM THE THIRD SECTION, THE PROVISION TO ALLOW THE PRESIDENT TO AUGMENT SOLDIERS RATIONS WHEN HE DEEMS NECESSARY.

TO READ THE RESOLUTIONS, FROM A MEETING OF THE MANUFACTURERS OF THE CITY OF PHILADELPHIA, RESPECTING A FURTHER REVENUE TAX BY AN EXCISE UPON CERTAIN DOMESTIC MANUFACTURES, CONTEMPLATED BY THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES.
TO PUT THE MAIN QUESTION ON THE MOTION TO DISMISS THE MANUFACTURES RESOLUTION.
TO DISMISS THE MANUFACTURES RESOLUTION.

TO REFER TO A SELECT COMMITTEE, H.J.R. 7, A RESOLUTION TO FURNISH THE EXECUTIVES OF THE SEVERAL STATES WITH A COPY OF A BOOK, DEPOSITED IN THE TREASURY DEPARTMENT BY THE COMMISSIONERS WHO SETTLED THE ACCOUNTS BETWEEN THE INDIVIDUAL STATES AND THE UNITED TATES.

TO CONCUR IN THE AMENDED VERSION OF H.J.R. 7, A RESOLUTION TO FURNISH THE EXECUTIVES OF THE STATES WITH A COPY OF A CERTAIN BOOK RELATED TO STATE DEBTS; WHICH AMENDMENT ADDS AFTER "SEVERAL STATES", THE WORDS "AT THEIR OWN EXPENSE".

TO AGREE TO THE FIRST SECTION OF S. 15, (APP. 6/5/1794), A BILL TO AUTHORIZE THE PRESIDENT, DURING CONGRESSIONAL RECESS TO OBTAIN A NUMBER OF VESSELS FOR THE SERVICE OF THE UNITED STATES; FIRST SECTION TO SPECIFY WHEN PRESIDENT MAY EXERCISE THIS POWER.  P

TO AMEND S. 15, (APP. 6/5/1794), A BILL TO AUTHORIZE THE PRESIDENT, DURING CONGRESSIONAL RECESS, TO OBTAIN A NUMBER OF VESSELS FOR THE SERVICE OF THE UNITED STATES, BY APPROPRIATING $150,000 FROM PROCEEDS OF UNITED STATES REVENUES, AND TO AUTHORIZE THE PESIDENT TO MAKE A LOAN FOR $150,000.

TO AGREE TO THE AMENDMENT OF THE SELECT COMMITTEE TO H.R. 39 (APP. 5/31/1794), A BILL TO MAKE PROVISIONS FOR THE PAYMENT OF INTEREST ON THE BALANCE DUE TO CERTAIN STATES UPON FINAL SETTLEMENT OF THE ACCOUNTS BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE INDIVIDUAL SATES.
TO RECOMMIT H.R. 39 TO THE SELECT COMMITTEE WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO REPORT AN AMENDMENT CARRYING INTO EFFECT AN ASSUMPTION OF THE DOMESTIC DEBTS OF THE CREDITOR STATES.
TO AMEND H.R. 39, BY STRIKING OUT THE FIRST SECTION WHICH DEFINES THE INTEREST SCHEDULE.

TO AMEND S. 18, A BILL TO INCREASE THE MILITARY POWER OF THE UNITED STATES, AND TO ENCOURAGE THE RECRUITING SERVICE; BY STRIKING OUT THE SECTION TO AUTHORIZE THE PRESIDENT TO RAISE ADDITIONAL MILITARY FORCE, AS CIRCUMSTANCES PERMIT.
TO POSTPONE H.R. 39, UNTIL THE NEXT SESSION.
TO AMEND S. 18, BY RESTORING THE SECTION WHICH ALLOWS EACH NON-COMMISSIONED OFFICER, MUSICIAN AND PRIVATE, A RAISE OF $1 PER MONTH.  (P. 113A)

TO AMEND H.R. 30, (APP. 6/4/1794, 1 STAT 372), A BILL TO AUTHORIZE THE PRESIDENT TO LAY, REGULATE AND REVOKE EMBARGOES; SAID AMENDMENT WOULD RESTRICT THE PRESIDENT'S AUTHORITY WHILE CONGRESS IS IN SESSION.

TO AMEND H.R. 20, (APP. 6/5/1794, 1 STAT 373), A BILL TO LAY CERTAIN DUTIES ON SNUFF AND SUGAR, BY STRIKING OUT THE SECTIONS TO PROVIDE A DUTY OF 8 CENTS PER POUND ON SNUFF AND A DUTY OF TWO CENTS PER POUND ON SUGAR.  (P. 116)
TO PASS H.R. 55, (APP. 6/4/1794, 1 STAT 372), A BILL TO LAY DUTIES UPON CARRIAGES FOR THE CONVEYANCE OF PERSONS.

TO ADOPT THE COMMITTEE REPORT TO AMEND H.R. 49, A BILL FOR THE MORE EFFECTUAL PROTECTION OF THE SOUTHWESTERN FRONTIER SETTLERS; SAID AMENDMENT TO STRIKE OUT THE SECTIONS AUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT TO CALL OUT THE MILITIA AGAINST THE CREEK AND CHEROKEE INDANS, ESTABLISHING CERTAIN MILITARY POSTS; AND THAT THE MILITIA RECEIVE THE SAME RATE OF PAY AS REGULAR UNITED STATES TROOPS.
TO ADOPT THE SELECT COMMITTEE REPORT TO AMEND H.R. 49, BY AUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT TO RAISE, FOR 3 YEARS, AN ADDITIONAL REGIMENT, WITH CERTAIN STIPULATIONS.  (P. 124B)
TO AMEND H.R. 49, BY STRIKING OUT THE SECTION REGARDING HOSTILITIES AGAINST INDIANS AND RULES OF WAR.  (P. 125)
TO CONSIDER EACH PARAGRAPH OF H.R. 57, A BILL TO PROVIDE FOR THE PAYMENT OF A CERTAIN SUM OF MONEY DUE TO THE FRENCH REPUBLIC.
TO AMEND H.R. 49, BY ADDING STIPULATIONS TO THE PROVISION AUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT TO RAISE AN ADDITIONAL REGIMENT. (P. 131)
TO POSTPONE CONSIDERATION OF THE LAST SECTION OF H.R. 49.

TO AMEND H.R. 74, (APP. 1/2/1795, 1 STAT 408), A BILL TO REGULATE THE PAY OF THE NON-COMMISSIONED OFFICERS, MUSICIANS, AND PRIVATES OF THE MILITIA, WHEN CALLED INTO ACTUAL SERVICE, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES, BY STRIKING OUT THE SECTION REGARDING ADDITIONAL OMPENSATION TO MEMBERS OF THE MILITIA ON AN EXPEDITION TO FORT PITT.
TO AMEND H.R. 74, BY INCLUDING IN THE EXTRA COMPENSATION, ANOTHER CATEGORY OF MEMBERS OF THE MILITIA.
TO PASS H.R. 74.

TO AMEND H.R. 83, (APP. 1/29/1795 1 STAT 414), A BILL TO ESTABLISH A UNIFORM RULE OF NATURALIZATION, AND TO REPEAL THE ACT HERETOFORE PASSED ON THAT SUBJECT; BY PROVIDING THAT ANY ALIEN, BEING A FREE WHITE PERSON, MAY BE ADMITTED TO BECOME A CITIZEN OF AY OF THE UNITED STATES

TO AMEND H.R. 76, (APP. 1/29/1795, 1 STAT 411), A BILL TO MAKE FURTHER PROVISIONS IN CASES OF DRAWBACKS; BY STRIKING THE THIRD SECTION REGARDING TRANSFER OF LIQUORS, COFFEE, AND UNREFINED SUGARS FROM DAMAGED CONTAINERS TO NEW CONTAINERS. (P. 813)

TO AMEND H.R. 98, (APP. 2/21/1795, 1 STAT 418), AN ACT SUPPLEMENTARY TO THE ACT CONCERNING INVALIDS, BY STRIKING OUT THE LAST SECTION AND INSERTING A PROVISION FORBIDDING THE RECEIVING OF PENSIONS BY OFFICERS RECEIVING COMMUTATION OF HALF PAY EXCEPT IN CRTAIN CASES
TO AGREE TO THE LAST SECTION OF H.R. 98, AS AMENDED, WHICH SECTION FORBIDS THE RECEIVING OF PENSIONS BY OFFICERS RECEIVING COMMUTATION OF HALF PAY, EXCEPT IN CERTAIN CASES.
TO PASS H.R. 98.
TO ORDER THIRD READING OF H.R. 119, (APP. 2/27/1795, 6 STAT 19), A BILL AUTHORIZING THE PAYMENT OF $4,000 FOR THE DAUGHTERS OF THE LATE COUNT DE GRASSE.

TO AMEND S. 34, (APP. 3/3/1795, 1 STAT 442), A BILL TO AUTHORIZE A GRANT OF LANDS TO THE FRENCH INHABITANTS OF GALLIOPOLIS, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES; BY STRIKING OUT THE FIRST SECTION AUTHORIZING THE PRESIDENT TO GRANT TO CERTAIN NAMED INDIVIDUALS, 2400 ACES OF LAND
TO ORDER THIRD READING OF S. 30, A BILL TO PREVENT DEPREDATIONS ON THE INDIANS SOUTH OF THE OHIO RIVER.
TO PASS S. 30, A BILL TO PREVENT DEPREDATIONS ON THE INDIANS SOUTH OF THE OHIO RIVER.

TO AMEND H.R. 110, (APP. 3/3/1795, 1 STAT 433), A BILL FOR THE SUPPORT OF THE PUBLIC CREDIT, AND FOR THE REDEMPTION OF THE PUBLIC DEBT; BY STRIKING OUT FROM THE SECOND SECTION "MAY BE REIMBURSED AT ANY TIME" AND INSERT "SHALL BE REIMBURSED WITHIN TWENTY EARS AND MAY BE REIMBURSED AT ANY TIME AFTER THE EXPIRATION OF TWELVE YEARS."
TO PASS S. 34, (APP. 3/3/1795, 1 STAT 442), A BILL TO AUTHORIZE A GRANT OF LANDS TO THE FRENCH INHABITANTS OF GALLIOPOLIS, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES.
TO PASS H.R. 110, (APP. 3/3/1795, 1 STAT 433), A BILL FOR THE SUPPORT OF THE PUBLIC CREDIT AND REDEMPTION OF THE PUBLIC DEBT.
TO PASS H.R. 113, (APP. 3/3/1795, 1 STAT 433), A BILL FOR THE MORE EFFECTUAL RECOVERY OF DEBTS DUE FROM INDIVIDUALS TO THE UNITED STATES.
TO DISPENSE WITH THE RULES AND ORDER SECOND READING OF H.R. 114, A BILL TO LAY DUTIES ON CARRIAGES FOR THE CONVEYANCE OF PERSONS, AND TO REPEAL THE FORMER ACT FOR **MISSING TEXT**
TO ORDER THIRD READING OF H.R. 124, (APP. 3/3/1795, 1 STAT 443, A BILL TO MAKE PROVISIONS FOR    S THE PURPOSES OF A TREATY AND TRADE WITH THE INDIANS.
TO AGREE TO SENATE JOINT RESOLUTION 5, RELATIVE TO THE TITLE OF CERTAIN LANDS SITUATED IN THE SOUTHWESTERN PARTS OF THE UNITED STATES.
